com.ibm.db2.r2dbc

Interface DB2Blob

  • All Superinterfaces:
    io.r2dbc.spi.Blob

    public interface DB2Blob
extends io.r2dbc.spi.Blob
    DB2Blob represents a binary large object. The contents of this large object is published as a stream of ByteBuffer by its publisher. You can get access to this publisher using the stream() method.

    Example:

    
 		// retrieve a blob column from the result set row
		DB2Blob blob1 = (DB2Blob) row.get("DATA1");
		blob1.stream().subscribe(b -> {
			// assuming the bytes represent a character string
			System.out.println("DATA1: "+new String(b.array())); 
		});

    • Method Summary
